Article Title: The New Financial Development Paradigm and Asian Bond Markets
Author Keywords: financial system development; financial crisis; bond markets; East Asia; economic constructivism
Abstract: For the better part of the last century, the debate between 'liberalisers' and 'interventionists' marked thinking about the relationship between finance and development. It has by now been superseded by the emergence of the discourse of financial system development, which links economic growth to the development of the financial sector. As the risks entailed by wholesale financial reform came to the fore in the financial crises of the 1990s and early 2000s, emphasis shifted from liberalising financial markets to building institutional frameworks to accommodate investment. Arguably, the emergence of the financial-system-development discourse occurred within a wider shift in the neoliberal paradigm towards institution building. These changes are particularly pronounced in East and Southeast Asia. This paper argues that a convergence of opinions has occurred between Asian financial policy elites, previously strong supporters of the bank-based developmental state model, and the liberalisers, represented through international financial institutions such as the IMF. This consensus is geared towards the expansion of capital markets and a generally more neoliberal, market-oriented mode of economic governance. To illustrate this claim, this paper traces institutional changes in Asian financial systems since the 1997-98 financial crisis. Although local characteristics remain, a common feature is the more salient role of bond markets in the financial system. This is the result of the conscious and deliberate development of local currency debt markets by policymakers. However, the new consensus narrows down the space in which economic policymaking takes place. Yet, by re-politicising financial system development, this space could be broadened again.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF SHANGHAI CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY (MOT 2010)
Conference Title: Shanghai Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol Econom,Shanghai Inst Technol, Sch Econom & Management
Author Keywords: patent comprehensive strength; principal component analysis; original innovative ability
Abstract: Firstly this paper synthetically evaluates the patent development of 10 chief cities in our country by using the principal component analysis, then it divides patent strength of each city into grades by using the clustering analysis, finally according to the comparison among the countries. It points out that our country not only at the level of the nation as a whole, but also at the level of the city region has its shortcomings of lacking original innovative capability.

Article Title: A Quantitative Analysis of the Functions of the Logistics Industry on the Economic Growth in Yunnan Province
Source Title: STATISTIC APPLICATION IN MACROECONOMY AND INDUSTRY SECTORS
Conference Title: 3rd International Institute of Statistics and Management Engineering Symposium
Author Keywords: Yunnan; Logistics industry; Economic growth; Quantitative analysis
Abstract: The development of modern logistics industry is a necessary requirement for economic and social development, with economic globalization and the rapid development of information technology, its development level has become an important symbol to measure the overall competitiveness of a country or a region. s an advanced organizational method and managerial technology, the modern logistics is widely regarded as the profit source for enterprises besides lowering material consumption and improving labor productivity, plays an important role in the national economy and social development. Based on the elaboration of the development of logistics industry in Yunnan, this paper analyzes the geographical and the economic environment of the development of logistics industry in Yunnan, demonstrates the mechanism of the logistics industry on economic growth, and finally applies econometric methods to do quantitative analysis on the functions of the logistics industry on economic growth in Yunnan to provide the necessary basis for decision making on determining the status of the logistics industry on economic development in Yunnan Province and formulating development plans for the logistics industry in Yunnan Province.

Article Title: Beyond Regulation: Towards a Cultural Political Economy of Complexity and Emergence
Author Keywords: Regulation approach; critical realism; capital accumulation; state regulation; cultural political economy; knowledge-based economy
Keywords Plus: STATE; TERRITORIALITY; SOVEREIGNTY; DISCOURSE; SCALE; URBAN
Abstract: Drawing on and contributing to materialist state theory, the regulation approach and institutional economics for more than three decades, Bob Jessop can certainly be considered one of the foremost Marxist political economists of our time. Recently, he has taken on board the cultural turn in social analysis by developing a highly original cultural political economy of the knowledge-based economy. As a contribution to the further development of a cultural political economy that is sensitive to the cultural dimensions of social life while retaining an emphasis on capital accumulation and state regulation, this article directs attention to the limits of Jessop's approach and suggests possible amendments to the theory. In particular, the article highlights the need to move beyond a concern with regulation towards a cultural political economy of complexity and emergence.

Article Title: The Study on Economic Development of the Urban Group along Huaihe River in Anhui Based on the Role of the Banking Sector
Source Title: STATISTIC APPLICATION IN MACROECONOMY AND INDUSTRY SECTORS
Conference Title: 3rd International Institute of Statistics and Management Engineering Symposium
Author Keywords: The urban group along Huaihe River in Anhui; Economic situation; The banking sector
Abstract: The urban group along Huaihe River in Anhui is rich in coal, electricity, iron ore, arable land and rural labor force resource, but its economic development is relatively weak in long time. Therefore, to analyze the cause and explore the path of economic development is great significant. This paper analyzes firstly the resource and economic situation in this region, then explore its economic development strategy based on the role of the banking sector.

Article Title: The Theoretical Analysis and Empirical Study on Public Investment Corruption and Economic Growth
Source Title: STATISTIC APPLICATION IN MACROECONOMY AND INDUSTRY SECTORS
Conference Title: 3rd International Institute of Statistics and Management Engineering Symposium
Author Keywords: Public investment corruption; Economic growth; Theoretical and empirical research
Abstract: In this paper, we carry on the theoretical analysis and empirical study on public investment corruption and economic growth. Our methodology improves on previous research on this topic by explicitly recognizing the role of simultaneity between public investment corruption and growth. Our primary results are twofold. First, corruption increases public investment. Second, public investment corruption reduces the returns to public investment and makes it ineffective in raising economic growth.

Article Title: An Empirical Study on the Impact of External Factors on Consumers' Green Consumption Behavior
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF SHANGHAI CONFERENCE ON MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY (MOT 2010)
Conference Title: Shanghai Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Technol Econom,Shanghai Inst Technol, Sch Econom & Management
Author Keywords: green consumption; consumer; green culture; subjective norms; commercial environment; habits; 5Rs
Abstract: Green consumption is a kind of new consumption pattern and life concept, and is the necessary requirement of sustainable development strategy. From last century, literatures focus on the internal factors causing green consumption behavior, such as demographic variables and psychological variables. This paper works on mechanism of green consumption behavior focusing more on external factors, rather than internal factors. Consumer green culture, subjective norms, habits and commercial environment, the four external factors, which with one internal factor, green consumption attitude, is studied in this paper. The impact of the five variables on each dimensions of green consumption behavior is verified. And the results show that different dimension of green consumption behavior has different pre-factors.

Article Title: Based on Price Index: Study on Relationship of Foreign Futures Price and China Economic Fluctuation
Source Title: STATISTIC APPLICATION IN MACROECONOMY AND INDUSTRY SECTORS
Conference Title: 3rd International Institute of Statistics and Management Engineering Symposium
Conference Location: Wei Hai Lu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Author Keywords: Transmission mechanism; Futures prices index; Cause-and-effect relationship; Model analysis
Abstract: This dissertation focuses on a relationship between foreign futures prices index represented by RJ/CRB index and China economic fluctuation. According to alterations of China politics and economy, we divide 150 prices indexes into 3 parts. Based on each part, Cause-and-effect relationship connecting foreign futures price with China economy development is analyzed by software Eviews. Furthermore, time series model is used for forecast and analysis. In-depth proposals are put forward in the last part.
